alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 8:43PM EDT until April 06 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON...COLLETON...BERKELEY AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 842 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Jacksonboro, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: North Charleston, Summerville, Hanahan, Ladson, Givhans Ferry State Park, Dorchester, Ravenel, Ridgeville, Cottageville, Givhans, Jedburg, Jacksonboro, Ritter, Round O and Delemar Crossroads. This warning includes I-26 between mile markers 202 and 208. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
